numbered_ace_sentences: 1. New technology exists all over the world.
2. The electricity generation in the world has steadily increased over the last 20 years.
3. Fossil-fuel electricity generation has increased as well.
4. The increase of fossil-fuel electricity generation is slower than the increase of total electricity generation.
5. Renewable energy sources have begun to take up a large proportion of worldwide electricity generation.
6. The country-specific plots show interesting trends.
7. The electricity generation in the United States has been mostly flat for two decades.
8. Economic development happened in the 21st century.
9. I wonder why the electricity generation in the United States has been mostly flat for two decades.
11. In my community, I hear about renewable energy through campaigns.
12. The graphs show that the rate of increase of fossil-fuel electricity generation has slowed down dramatically.
13. In the United States, the rate of increase of fossil-fuel electricity generation has slowed down dramatically.
15. This affects everyone in my community.
17. If renewable energy reduces air pollution then overall health becomes better.
18. The headline is: Fueling the Future: Cleaning Up Our Energy.
